III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has been touching Youth B's butt and is watching him
shower.
Investigation The complaint received noted the following: Youth A (15) and
Youth B (17) are wards that reside in the same building of
Methodist Children's Home. Supervisor 1 is a staff member at the
facility. On 3/1/23 @ 8pm law enforcement was called to the
facility for a physical altercation between Youth A and Youth B.
There is an on-going concern that Youth B has been touching
Youth A's butt and watching him shower. Supervisor 1 reported
this was the first that he'd ever heard this. But this was
documented earlier in the day to a therapist. Youth B was
removed from being in the same building as Youth A.
The complainant did not return my phone call or email. Youth A
and Youth B’s workers were notified and had no further
information to add.
I interviewed Youth A on 3/6/23 at the facility. Youth A reported
that Youth B touched his butt over his clothes when they were
wrestling in the TV area of the cottage on 3/1/23. He reported that
Youth B apologized for accidentally touching his butt but then
touched him on the front, over his clothes, on his penis. Youth A
reported this happened one time on 3/1/23 and had never
happened before. Youth A reported Youth Worker 1 and Youth
Worker 2 saw Youth B touch him inappropriately. He indicated
Youth Worker 1 was making dinner and Youth Worker 2 was
passing medication. Youth A reported that Youth B is a little
sneaky when he does things and does them when staff are not
looking. Youth A reported that Youth C and Youth D saw Youth B
touch his butt and penis. Youth A denied that Youth B has
watched him in the shower. He reported Youth B opened the
shower door one-time months ago by accident as he didn't know
Youth A was in there. Youth A reported that Youth B touches his
2

upper body with his hands every weekend. Youth A rubbed his
hands all over his chest, arm and back area, over his clothes, as
an example of what Youth B does. He could not identify the
number of times it has occurred but indicated "more times than I
can count". Youth A reported this touching is not sexual, and staff
tell Youth B to chill out and to stop touching Youth A. Youth A then
reported that Youth B opened the bathroom door on him three
times without knocking but closed the door when Youth A told him
to close it. He did not feel that his behavior was sexual or that he
was attempting to watch him or touch him. He denied that Youth
B has touched him in the shower or bathroom.
This writer interviewed Youth C on 3/6/23 at the facility. Youth C
reported he has never seen Youth B touch Youth A in his private
areas. Youth C reported he has never seen Youth B touch anyone
inappropriately. He reported that Youth A and Youth B argue, fight
and wrestle a lot. Youth C reported that Youth B stays in his room
most of the time and does not interact with the other youth in the
cottage. Youth C reported that he has never seen or heard Youth
B was watching Youth A in the shower. He reported there would
be no way to watch someone in the shower as they have
individual stalls with doors.
I interviewed Youth B on 3/6/23 at the facility. Youth B reported
that he is upset that the facility puts older and younger youth in the
same building, and he wants to report that. He reported the
younger youth mess with him and then he gets in trouble because
he is so much older than some of them. He is concerned he could
get charges pressed against him because of his age. Youth B
reported that Youth A made a false allegation on him and said he
touched him. Youth B denied that he has ever touched Youth A in
his private areas or that he has watched him in the shower. He
reported that Youth A picks at him and irritates him which results
in horse play and wrestling. Youth B reported he is frustrated with
Youth A as he won't listen to him and is always instigating. Youth
B reported he asked for his flops (sandals) back from Youth A and
Youth A threw them at him. Youth B reported that he does wrestle
with Youth A but has never slammed him to the ground or touched
him on his buttocks or penis. Youth B reported that Youth A threw
a basketball at him, and he shoved him. Youth B reported he later
apologized to Youth A for shoving him.
I interviewed Youth Worker 1 on 3/6/23 at the facility. She
reported she has worked at the facility for 5 years. Youth Worker 1
reported she has never seen any sexual touching with Youth A or
Youth B. She reported the boys do wrestle too much and shoot
3

nerf guns at one another. Youth Worker 1 reported that both
Youth A and Youth B instigate one another and play too much.
She reported Youth B is aggressive and hits and punches Youth
A. Youth Worker 1 reported she has to tell Youth B to stop due to
his age and that he is too big for what he is doing. Youth Worker 1
reported she remembers Youth A and Youth B goofing around
and that Youth A said Youth B made him fall down and he had a
bruise on his arm. She checked his arm and there was not a
bruise and Youth A told her he was okay. Youth Worker 1
reported they do not pass medications and make dinner at the
same time as they need to have line of sight at all times. She
reported medications are passed at 7pm and dinner is at 5-
5:30pm. Youth Worker 1 reported Youth Worker 2 was sitting in
the back watching TV with Youth A and Youth B but she didn't see
what happened as she was passing medication.
I interviewed Youth Worker 2 at the facility on 3/6/23. He reported
he did not work the night of 3/1/23 and he only works on
weekends in Youth A and Youth B's cottage. He denied that he
worked with Youth Worker 1 on 3/1/23.
I interviewed Youth Worker 3 on 3/6/23 at the facility. She
reported she has been a Youth Specialist for 4 years. Youth
Worker 3 reported that Youth A and Youth B were outside and
had words and were arguing as Youth A had gone AWOL for a
few hours earlier that day. Later that evening Youth B got into a
fight with Youth D and the front window was broken out as they
were arguing and fighting with one boy inside the building and the
other outside the building. When Youth B was inside the building,
he told Youth A to give him his “fucking” flops and Youth A threw
them at him. Youth Worker 3 reported Youth A and Youth B horse
play and wrestle too much. She reported that Youth B picks on
and bullies Youth A. She denied ever seeing Youth B touch Youth
A inappropriately that evening or any other time. Youth Worker 3
reported that she has seen Youth B touch Youth A's upper body
when they are wrestling. Youth Worker 3 stressed there is a lot of
horse play and wrestling and she does not agree with it. She
reported she has never seen or heard anything about Youth B
watching Youth A in the shower. Youth Worker 3 reported they do
dinner about 5-5:30pm and pass medication at 6:30-7pm. Youth
Worker 3 denied seeing Youth B touch Youth A on his butt or
penis on the evening of 3/1/23 or any other time.
I interviewed the Shift Leader on 3/6/23 at the facility. He reported
he has been working at the facility since February. He reported
the night of 3/1/23 Youth B and Youth D got into a fight. The two
4

youth had been bickering and arguing all day and staff were trying
to keep them separated. Staff asked Youth B to go inside and
Youth D to be outside with the other youth. Youth B went over to
the window and began arguing through the glass and Youth D
reacted back by banging on the glass breaking it. The police were
called due to this incident. Shift Leader reported when the police
arrived, he was in the back of the building by the staff desk. He
heard Youth B ask Youth A for his flops and Youth A threw them
at him. The Shift Leader reported he has never seen Youth A and
Youth B wrestle or play too much. He has never seen or heard of
any inappropriate touch between the two youth or with anyone
else. He reported when Youth A threw the flops at Youth B the
police officer saw the shoes being thrown and intervened with
Youth A and asked him why he was throwing the shoes and would
he throw shoes at the officer like that. Shift Leader reported Youth
A began to cry really hard and he heard Youth A say Youth B has
been touching me and that he touched Youth A's butt that night.
Shift Leader said he had never seen Youth A cry so hard and that
he typically has a very tough attitude and way about him. Shift
Leader reported they had cooked dinner about 4:30pm and had
dinner at 5pm. They passed medication at 7-8pm. Shift leader
reported they have three staff in the cottage in the evening so if
dinner and medications are being done there is another staff for
line of sight. The Shift Leader reported that Youth B is a loner and
stays in his room. He indicated he often doesn't even eat dinner
with the other youth or staff.
I interviewed Youth Worker 4 on 3/6/23 at the facility. She
reported she has worked at the facility for the past 6 years. Youth
Worker 4 gave a consistent account of the boys’ interactions
leading up to the police being onsite. Youth Worker 4 reported the
police officer saw the shoes fly and confronted Youth A with a
raised voice and Youth A immediately began to cry. Youth Worker
4 reported Youth A then said, “I am tired of Youth B fucking with
me and trying to touch me inappropriately.” Youth Worker 4
reported Youth A said he was touched on his bootie when Youth B
came into the bathroom. Youth A reportedly said he was tired of
feeling scared of Youth B. Youth D also reported that night he did
not feel safe with Youth B. Youth Worker 4 reported Youth B has
a history of bullying other youth and that he chooses to stay in his
room most of the time. Youth Worker 4 reported they cook dinner
about 4-5pm and eat about 5:30pm and pass medication about 7-
8pm. She indicated they have 3 staff on to ensure line of sight is
kept. Youth Worker 4 reported she has never seen Youth B touch
Youth A on his butt or penis. Youth Worker 4 denied she has ever
heard of Youth A or B touching other youth inappropriately. Youth
5

Worker 4 denied that she has ever seen or heard that Youth B
was looking at Youth A in the shower. She reported this could not
happen as they have 3 showers with doors all next to one another
and staff sit at the desk right outside the shower area. Youth
Worker 4 denied they have issues with other youth walking in on
others showering. Youth Worker 4 reported that Youth A was
crying very hard that evening and was very emotional which
seemed genuine to her. Youth Worker 4 reported that Youth A is
the youngest in the cottage and that he is a sweet kid who says he
feels unsafe with Youth B.
I interviewed the Clinical Director on 3/6/23 at the facility. He
reported he met with Youth A on 3/2/23, the morning after Youth A
reported he was being touched by Youth B. Youth A told the
Clinical Director he was upset that Youth B touched his butt and
private parts. The Clinical Director reported Youth A reported he
was exploring is trauma history and what Youth B did to him was
similar to past incidents from his history. Youth A reported to the
Clinical Director that he was play fighting with Youth B and Youth
B pushed him down and slapped his butt and grabbed his private
part. Youth A reported this has been an on-going issue for the
past couple weeks and he was uncomfortable telling his therapist
as she is new and female. Clinical Director reported that he and
Youth A did safety planning and the boys had been separated the
evening before into separate cottages. The Clinical Director
reported the safety plan also included line of sight on both boys at
all times. Youth A reported to the Clinical Director that Youth B
walked into the shower about three weeks ago and Youth A told
him to leave, and he did.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 3/6/23 at the facility. He reported he
has worked at the facility since December and did the same work
at another facility for 30 years. Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A
and B had words that evening, and Youth B got into a fight with
Youth D. Supervisor 1 reported the police were called to restore
the calm. He reported while the police were at the cottage Youth
A threw Youth B's flops at him after being asked to return them.
The officer raised his voice after seeing this and questioned Youth
A about his actions. Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A began to
cry, and that Youth A is often good at stirring things up but not
having to answer to his behaviors. Supervisor 1 was not sure if the
officer intimidated Youth A resulting in his crying. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A was crying and told the officer that Youth B
walked in on him in the restroom, and he was doing "sexy acting
out". Supervisor 1 reported this a term he used and he believes
that Youth A picked up the language but it meant he was coming
6

in to look at him. Supervisor 1 reported they separated the boys
that evening in different cottages for the safety of everyone.
Supervisor 1 reported he has never seen or heard that Youths A
or B touched other youth sexually or on their private parts.
Supervisor 1 reported the youth have 3 separate shower stalls
with individual doors. Supervisor 1 reported a staff member is
always outside the bathroom shower area when a youth is
showering.
Documents reviewed:
Incident report was reviewed from 3/1/23 authored by Supervisor
1. Report was consistent with Supervisor 1 interview.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports Youth A
was touched on his butt or penis by Youth B or that he was
watched in the shower. All staff and youth deny that Youth B was
watching Youth A in the shower, and Youth A clarified that Youth
B walked in but left when Youth A told him to leave. Youth A
further said he did not feel that Youth B walking in was sexual or
that he was attempting to watch him or touch him. Youth A reports
he was touched by Youth B accidently on the butt on 3/1/23 and
Youth B apologized. He reports after apologizing Youth B touched
him over his pants on his penis and this was reported to have
occurred while the two were horse playing. All staff and youth
interviewed denied seeing Youth B touch Youth A on the butt and
penis. Youth B denied touching Youth A on his butt or penis.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Horseplay and wrestling should not be permitted in the cottages
as the youth escalate and it leads to further behavioral issues.
Having youth that are younger and older mixed in a cottage
should be done cautiously. The youth have different abilities,
capabilities and interests and this can lead to behavioral issues
between the youth.
Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
